intro: Amphoricarpos neumayerianus, commonly known as the Neumayer's amphora-berry, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, bottle-shaped fruits that resemble small amphorae. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its small, compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers contribute to its ecological significance in its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
